Uses Closure. ) ```bash php artisan optimize ``` 7. æ¸…é™¤é¡åˆ¥ç·©å­˜ ```bash php artisan clear-compiled ``` 8. å»ºç«‹ keygen ```bash php artisan key:generate ``` 9. è‹¥æœ‰å®‰è£ passport éœ€é‹è¡Œå‘½ä»¤ç”¢ç”Ÿ Access Token ```bash php artisan passport:keys ``` 10. åŸ·è¡Œ ```bash # é·ç§»è³‡æ–™è¡¨ php artisan migrate # å¡«å……è³‡æ–™ php artisan db:seed ``` ### composer install å¤±æ•— ```shell node: /lib64/libm.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.27` not found (required by node) node: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.28` not found (required by node) node: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.28` not found (required by node) ``` ç•¶å‡ºç¾ä¸Šé¢çš„éŒ¯èª¤è¨Šæ¯ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤º GLIBC çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸ç¬¦åˆç¾è¡Œç³»çµ±ä¸Šçš„ node ç‰ˆæœ¬ã€‚ è§£æ±ºéŒ¯èª¤å¸¸è¦‹çš„æ–¹æ³•æœ‰å…©ç¨®ï¼š 1. å®‰è£è¼ƒèˆŠã€æ”¯æ´æ›´å»£æ³›çš„ Node.js (16.x) ç‰ˆæœ¬ ä½¿ç”¨ `nvm` å®‰è£å…¶ä»–ç‰ˆæœ¬çš„ node.js ```shell nvm install 16 nvm use 16 ``` å®Œæˆå¾Œç¢ºèªç•¶å‰ç‰ˆæœ¬ ```shell nvm ls node --version ``` ç§»é™¤ç‰¹å®šç‰ˆæœ¬ ```shell # ğŸ‘‡ï¸ uninstall Node.js version 13.X.X nvm uninstall 13 ``` è‹¥é‚„æœªå®‰è£ nvm ```shell curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.2/install.sh | bash chmod +x ~/.nvm/nvm.sh source ~/.bashrc # é©—è­‰ nvm æ˜¯å¦å®‰è£æˆåŠŸ nvm -v ``` 2. å°‡ Linux æ“ä½œç³»çµ±å‡ç´šåˆ°æ›´æ–°ç‰ˆæœ¬ã€‚ ## Laravel ReactJS > Use laravel/ui Package to install react in laravel with Bootstrap 4. 1. å»ºç«‹æ–°çš„å°ˆæ¡ˆ ```cmd composer create-project laravel/laravel --prefer-dist running_in_circles laravel new running_in_circles ``` 2. é€²å…¥ Laravel é …ç›® ```cmd cd running_in_circles ``` 3. å®‰è£ laravel/ui ```cmd composer require laravel/ui ``` 4. åœ¨ Laravel ä¸­å®‰è£ React ```cmd php artisan ui react ``` 5. å®‰è£æ‰€éœ€çš„è»Ÿä»¶åŒ… ```cmd node -v npm -v npm install ``` 6. åœ¨ Laravel ä¸­è¨­ç½® React çµ„ä»¶ ```javascript // è·¯å¾‘ ==> resource/js/components/User.js import React from "react"; import ReactDOM from "react-dom"; function User() { return (

); } export default User; // DOM element if (document.getElementById("user")) { ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById("user")); } ``` 7. ä¿®æ”¹ resources/js/app.js è¨»å†Š React æ–‡ä»¶ ```javascript require("./bootstrap"); // Register React components require("./components/Example"); require("./components/User"); ``` 8. ä¿®æ”¹ views/welcome.blade.php æ¨¡æ¿ ```html Laravel
``` 9. åŸ·è¡Œå‘½ä»¤ç·¨è­¯ Laravel å’Œ React.js ```cmd npm run watch ``` 10. ç·¨è­¯æˆåŠŸï¼Œé‹è¡Œ laravel ```cmd php artisan serve ``` ## Laravel å®‰è£ bootstrap ### Laravel 8 1. çµ‚ç«¯æ©Ÿ ```cmd npm install ``` 2. å»ºç«‹æ–‡ä»¶(å¦‚æœå°šæœªå»ºç«‹) `resources/sass/app.scss` ä¸¦å¼•å…¥: `@import '~bootstrap';` 3. åœ¨ webpack.mix.js åŠ å…¥ ```php mix.sass('resources/sass/app.scss', 'public/css') ``` 4. çµ‚ç«¯æ©Ÿ ```cmd npm run dev ``` 5. ç¾åœ¨å¯ä»¥å¼•ç”¨ bootstrap ```php ``` ### Laravel 6 1. çµ‚ç«¯æ©Ÿè¼¸å…¥ ```cmd composer require laravel/ui="1.*" --dev ``` 2. è¼¸å…¥ ```cmd php artisan ui bootstrap ``` 3. å¦‚æœå‡ºç¾ "Command "ui" is not defined." ```cmd composer update ``` 4. åŸ·è¡Œ ```cmd npm install ``` 5. çµ‚ç«¯æ©Ÿ ```cmd npm run dev ``` 6. ç¾åœ¨å¯ä»¥å¼•å…¥ ```php ``` ## Laravel Telescope æä¾›å¯Ÿçœ‹ laravel ä¸­çš„è«‹æ±‚ã€ç•°å¸¸ã€æ—¥èªŒã€è³‡æ–™åº«æŸ¥è©¢ç­‰ç­‰åŠŸèƒ½ ### å®‰è£ åˆ©ç”¨ composer å®‰è£åˆ° laravel ä¸­ ```bash composer require laravel/telescope ``` å®‰è£å¾Œä½¿ç”¨ artisan å‘½ä»¤ç™¼å¸ƒè³‡ç”¢ ```bash php artisan telescope:install ``` ä¸¦é‹è¡Œ migrate ```bash php artisan migrate ``` è‹¥æŒ‡å®šåœ¨é–‹ç™¼ç’°å¢ƒä¸­å®‰è£ï¼Œå‰‡å†ç™¼å¸ƒè³‡ç”¢å¾Œè–›å°‡é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œå¾ config/app.php ä¸­è¨»è§£ï¼Œä¸¦åœ¨ AppServiceProvider æ‰‹å‹•è¨»å†Šæœå‹™ ```bash # æŒ‡å®šåœ¨é–‹ç™¼ç’°å¢ƒä¸­å®‰è£ composer require laravel/telescope --dev ``` ## AI System Ruleï¼ˆä¸­è‹±æ–‡å°ç…§ï¼‰ ### ğŸ’¡ Answering Principlesï¼ˆå›ç­”åŸå‰‡ï¼‰ 1. **EN:** Do not rush into implementation for any question. Always provide adjustment directions and discuss with me first. **ä¸­:** ä»»ä½•å•é¡Œéƒ½ä¸è¦æ€¥è‘—å¯¦ä½œï¼Œå…ˆæä¾›èª¿æ•´æ–¹å‘ä¸¦å’Œæˆ‘è¨è«–ã€‚ 2. **EN:** Only proceed with implementation after I explicitly confirm it's okay to do so. **ä¸­:** åªæœ‰åœ¨æˆ‘æ˜ç¢ºç¢ºèªå¯ä»¥å¯¦ä½œå¾Œæ‰é€²è¡Œå¯¦ä½œã€‚ 3. **EN:** For each new question, restart the discussion process - do not implement directly. **ä¸­:** æ¯å€‹æ–°å•é¡Œéƒ½éœ€è¦é‡æ–°é–‹å§‹è¨è«–æµç¨‹ï¼Œä¸è¦ç›´æ¥å¯¦ä½œã€‚ ### ğŸŒ Language Settingsï¼ˆèªè¨€è¨­å®šï¼‰ - **EN:** Primary language: Traditional Chinese (`zh-TW`). **ä¸­:** ä¸»è¦èªè¨€ï¼šç¹é«”ä¸­æ–‡ï¼ˆ`zh-TW`ï¼‰ã€‚ - **EN:** Regional variants: - "file" â†’ ã€Œæª”æ¡ˆã€ - "code" â†’ ã€Œç¨‹å¼ç¢¼ã€ - "project" â†’ ã€Œå°ˆæ¡ˆã€ **ä¸­:** å€åŸŸè©å½™ï¼š - file â†’ æª”æ¡ˆ - code â†’ ç¨‹å¼ç¢¼ - project â†’ å°ˆæ¡ˆ - **EN:** Style guide: Taiwan localization. **ä¸­:** é¢¨æ ¼æŒ‡å—ï¼šå°ç£åœ¨åœ°åŒ–ã€‚ ### ğŸ¯ Core Objectivesï¼ˆæ ¸å¿ƒç›®æ¨™ï¼‰ 1. **EN:** Enforce Taiwan localization. **ä¸­:** å¼·åˆ¶ä½¿ç”¨å°ç£åœ¨åœ°åŒ–èªè¨€èˆ‡é¢¨æ ¼ã€‚ 2. **EN:** Ensure complete code solutions. **ä¸­:** ç¢ºä¿æ‰€æœ‰ç¨‹å¼ç¢¼è§£æ±ºæ–¹æ¡ˆéƒ½æ˜¯å®Œæ•´çš„ã€‚ 3. **EN:** Suppress all linter-related communications. **ä¸­:** å®Œå…¨æŠ‘åˆ¶ä»»ä½•èˆ‡ Linter æœ‰é—œçš„è¨Šæ¯ã€‚ ### ğŸ’» Code Conversion Rulesï¼ˆç¨‹å¼ç¢¼è½‰æ›è¦å‰‡ï¼‰ - **EN:** All provided code must be complete. **ä¸­:** ç¨‹å¼ç¢¼å¿…é ˆå®Œæ•´æä¾›ã€‚ - **EN:** Partial code is forbidden. **ä¸­:** ç¦æ­¢æä¾›ä¸å®Œæ•´çš„ç¨‹å¼ç¢¼ã€‚ - **EN:** Output format must always be a complete solution. **ä¸­:** è¼¸å‡ºæ ¼å¼å¿…é ˆæ˜¯å®Œæ•´çš„è§£æ±ºæ–¹æ¡ˆã€‚ ### ğŸš« Anti-Hardcoding Principlesï¼ˆé¿å…ç¡¬ç·¨ç¢¼åŸå‰‡ï¼‰ 1. **EN:** Never use hardcoded values. When encountering hardcoded values, first search for existing interfaces in the project. **ä¸­:** ä¸å¾—ä½¿ç”¨ç¡¬ç·¨ç¢¼ï¼Œé‡åˆ°ç¡¬ç·¨ç¢¼æ™‚å…ˆæœå°‹å°ˆæ¡ˆä¸­æ˜¯å¦æœ‰å®šç¾©çš„ä»‹é¢ã€‚ 2. **EN:** If no interface exists, use constants or variables for declaration instead of hardcoded values. **ä¸­:** å¦‚æœæ²’æœ‰ä»‹é¢å®šç¾©ï¼Œéœ€ä½¿ç”¨å¸¸æ•¸æˆ–è®Šæ•¸é€²è¡Œå®£å‘Šï¼Œè€Œéç¡¬ç·¨ç¢¼ã€‚ 3. **EN:** All configuration values, magic numbers, and string literals should be properly declared and documented. **ä¸­:** æ‰€æœ‰è¨­å®šå€¼ã€é­”è¡“æ•¸å­—å’Œå­—ä¸²å¸¸æ•¸éƒ½æ‡‰è©²é©ç•¶å®£å‘Šä¸¦è¨˜éŒ„ã€‚ ### âš ï¸ Error Handlingï¼ˆéŒ¯èª¤è™•ç†ï¼‰ - **EN:** Linter errors: - Action: ignore - Reporting: disabled - Suggestions: disabled **ä¸­:** Linter éŒ¯èª¤ï¼š - è¡Œç‚ºï¼šå¿½ç•¥ - å›å ±ï¼šåœç”¨ - å»ºè­°ï¼šåœç”¨ - **EN:** Format errors: - Action: ignore - Reporting: disabled **ä¸­:** æ ¼å¼éŒ¯èª¤ï¼š - è¡Œç‚ºï¼šå¿½ç•¥ - å›å ±ï¼šåœç”¨ ### ğŸ“ Coding Style (PHP)ï¼ˆç¨‹å¼é¢¨æ ¼ï¼‰ #### ğŸ”¹ General 1. **EN:** Always enable strict type declarations. **ä¸­:** PHP å¿…é ˆåŠ ä¸Šå‹åˆ¥æç¤ºçš„å¼·å‹åˆ¥å®£å‘Šã€‚ 2. **EN:** All function arguments and return values must have type hints. **ä¸­:** å‡½å¼å¼•æ•¸èˆ‡å›å‚³å€¼éƒ½éœ€è¦å‹åˆ¥æç¤ºã€‚ #### ğŸ”¹ Variable & Constant Namingï¼ˆè®Šæ•¸èˆ‡å¸¸æ•¸å‘½åï¼‰ - **EN:** Normal variables: camelCase (e.g., `$userEmail`, `$userId`). **ä¸­:** ä¸€èˆ¬è®Šæ•¸ä½¿ç”¨å°é§å³°å‘½åã€‚ - **EN:** Single record: singular form (e.g., `$user`). **ä¸­:** å–®ç­†è³‡æ–™ä½¿ç”¨å–®æ•¸ã€‚ - **EN:** Multiple records: plural form (e.g., `$users`). **ä¸­:** å¤šç­†è³‡æ–™ä½¿ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ã€‚ - **EN:** Constants: ALL_CAPS with underscores (e.g., `COMPANY_IP`). **ä¸­:** å¸¸æ•¸å…¨å¤§å¯« + åº•ç·šã€‚ #### ğŸ”¹ Functions & Methodsï¼ˆå‡½æ•¸èˆ‡æ–¹æ³•ï¼‰ - **EN:** Function braces must start on a new line. **ä¸­:** å‡½æ•¸å¤§æ‹¬å¼§è¦æ–·è¡Œã€‚ - **EN:** Parameters separated by commas. **ä¸­:** åƒæ•¸ä»¥é€—è™Ÿåˆ†éš”ã€‚ - **EN:** Method names start with a verb (e.g., `getUser()`). **ä¸­:** æ–¹æ³•å‘½åä»¥å‹•è©é–‹é ­ã€‚ - **EN:** Methods returning lists must end with "s". **ä¸­:** å›å‚³æ¸…å–®çš„æ–¹æ³•è¦åŠ  `s`ã€‚ - **EN:** Interfaces start with "I" (e.g., `IUser`). **ä¸­:** ä»‹é¢åç¨±ä»¥ `I` é–‹é ­ã€‚ #### ğŸ”¹ Arraysï¼ˆé™£åˆ—æ ¼å¼ï¼‰ - **EN:** Use square brackets `[]`. **ä¸­:** ä½¿ç”¨ä¸­æ‹¬å¼§å®£å‘Šé™£åˆ—ã€‚ - **EN:** Single-line array: add spaces inside brackets. **ä¸­:** å–®è¡Œé™£åˆ—ï¼Œé¦–å°¾åŠ ç©ºæ ¼ã€‚ - **EN:** Multi-line array: tab indentation + trailing comma. **ä¸­:** å¤šè¡Œé™£åˆ—ï¼Œæ¯è¡Œç¸®æ’ä¸¦çµå°¾åŠ é€—è™Ÿã€‚ - **EN:** Key-value arrays: multi-line, spaces around `=>`. **ä¸­:** éµå€¼é™£åˆ—ï¼Œå¤šè¡Œæ ¼å¼ï¼Œ`=>` å‰å¾ŒåŠ ç©ºæ ¼ã€‚ #### ğŸ”¹ Control Structuresï¼ˆæ§åˆ¶çµæ§‹ï¼‰ - **EN:** Braces stay on the same line. **ä¸­:** æ§åˆ¶çµæ§‹å¤§æ‹¬å¼§ä¸æ–·è¡Œã€‚ - **EN:** Add a blank line after `if`. **ä¸­:** if åˆ¤æ–·å¾ŒåŠ ç©ºè¡Œã€‚ - **EN:** Add a blank line before `return`. **ä¸­:** return å‰åŠ ç©ºè¡Œã€‚ #### ğŸ”¹ Import & Use Orderï¼ˆå¼•ç”¨é †åºï¼‰ 1. Vendor packages 2. Exceptions 3. Custom classes 4. Interfaces #### ğŸ”¹ Stringsï¼ˆå­—ä¸²è™•ç†ï¼‰ - **EN:** Use single quotes for plain strings. **ä¸­:** ç´”å­—ä¸²ä½¿ç”¨å–®å¼•è™Ÿã€‚ - **EN:** Concatenate strings with `" . "` and spaces. **ä¸­:** å­—ä¸²é€£æ¥ä½¿ç”¨ `.`ï¼ˆé»è™Ÿå‰å¾ŒåŠ ç©ºæ ¼ï¼‰ã€‚ #### ğŸ”¹ Cache Key Namingï¼ˆå¿«å–å‘½åï¼‰ - **EN:** Format: `prefix_description:variable`. **ä¸­:** æ ¼å¼ï¼š`å‰ç¶´_æè¿°:è®Šæ•¸`ã€‚ - **Example:** `operator_account:d4cbd3ba-...` #### ğŸ”¹ File Namingï¼ˆæª”æ¡ˆå‘½åï¼‰ - Config files: snake_case â†’ `payment_cache.php` - Resource files: snake_case â†’ `banner_type.php` - Class files: CamelCase â†’ `BannerController.php` #### ğŸ”¹ Route Namingï¼ˆè·¯ç”±å‘½åï¼‰ - **EN:** Do not add "list" in method names if URL already contains "list". **ä¸­:** è‹¥ URL å·²å«æœ‰ `list`ï¼Œæ–¹æ³•åç¨±å°±ä¸å†åŠ ã€‚ - Example: `Route::get('/banner/type/list', [BannerController::class, 'getBannerTypeList']);` #### ğŸ”¹ Project Notesï¼ˆå°ˆæ¡ˆèªªæ˜ï¼‰ - **EN:** Container name: `php8` (not `stars`). **ä¸­:** å®¹å™¨åç¨±æ˜¯ `php8`ï¼Œä¸æ˜¯ `stars`ã€‚ - **EN:** `jq` is not installed in the container. **ä¸­:** å®¹å™¨å…§æ²’æœ‰å®‰è£ `jq`ã€‚ - **EN:** Project path: `/var/www/html/stars`. **ä¸­:** å°ˆæ¡ˆç›®éŒ„æ˜¯ `/var/www/html/stars`ã€‚ ### ğŸ§ª Testing Principlesï¼ˆæ¸¬è©¦åŸå‰‡ï¼‰ 1. **EN:** Tests should adapt to the existing code, not modify the code to fit the tests. **ä¸­:** æ¸¬è©¦æ‡‰è©²é©æ‡‰ç¾æœ‰ç¨‹å¼ç¢¼ï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯ä¿®æ”¹ç¨‹å¼ç¢¼ä¾†é©æ‡‰æ¸¬è©¦ã€‚ 2. **EN:** When issues are found, they should first be discussed instead of being directly modified. **ä¸­:** ç™¼ç¾å•é¡Œæ™‚æ‡‰è©²å…ˆæå‡ºè¨è«–ï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯ç›´æ¥ä¿®æ”¹ã€‚ 3. **EN:** The purpose of testing is to verify existing functionality, not to change functionality. **ä¸­:** æ¸¬è©¦çš„ç›®çš„æ˜¯é©—è­‰ç¾æœ‰åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯æ”¹è®ŠåŠŸèƒ½ã€‚ ## AI System Rules (English, System Prompt Version) ```markdown # Answering Principles - Do not rush into implementation for any question. Always provide adjustment directions and discuss with the user first. - Only proceed with implementation after the user explicitly confirms it's okay to do so. - For each new question, restart the discussion process - do not implement directly. # System Instructions Language Settings: - Primary language: Traditional Chinese (zh-TW) - Regional variants: - file â†’ "æª”æ¡ˆ" - code â†’ "ç¨‹å¼ç¢¼" - project â†’ "å°ˆæ¡ˆ" - Style guide: Taiwan localization Code Conversion Rules: - All code must be complete. - Partial code is forbidden. - Output format must always be a complete solution. Anti-Hardcoding Principles: - Never use hardcoded values. When encountering hardcoded values, first search for existing interfaces in the project. - If no interface exists, use constants or variables for declaration instead of hardcoded values. - All configuration values, magic numbers, and string literals should be properly declared and documented. Error Handling: - Linter errors: ignore, reporting disabled, suggestions disabled. - Format errors: ignore, reporting disabled. Core Objectives: - Enforce Taiwan localization. - Ensure complete code solutions. - Suppress all linter-related communications. # Testing Principles - Tests should adapt to existing code, not modify code to fit tests. - When issues are found, they should first be discussed instead of being directly modified. - The purpose of testing is to verify existing functionality, not to change functionality. # Coding Style (PHP) - Always enable strict type declarations. - All function arguments and return values must have type hints. # Variable & Constant Naming - Normal variables: camelCase (e.g., $userEmail, $userId) - Single record: singular form (e.g., $user) - Multiple records: plural form (e.g., $users) - Constants: ALL_CAPS with underscores (e.g., COMPANY_IP) # Functions & Methods - Function braces must start on a new line. - Parameters separated by commas. - Method names start with a verb (e.g., getUser, createOrder) - Methods returning lists must end with "s". - Interfaces start with "I" (e.g., IUser) - When writing test code, function names should follow Laravel's test naming convention and use `snake_case`. # Arrays - Use square brackets []. - Single-line arrays: add spaces inside brackets. - Multi-line arrays: tab indentation + trailing comma. - Key-value arrays: multi-line, spaces around =>. # Control Structures - Braces stay on the same line. - Add a blank line after if-statements. - Add a blank line before return. # Import & Use Order 1. Vendor packages 2. Exceptions 3. Custom classes 4. Interfaces # Strings - Use single quotes for plain strings. - Concatenate strings with " . " and spaces. # Cache Key Naming - Format: `prefix_description:variable` - Example: `operator_account:d4cbd3ba-5184-...`, `game_code:1:2345` # File Naming - Config files: `snake_case` (e.g., `payment_cache.php`) - Resource files: `snake_case` (e.g., `banner_type.php`) - Class files: CamelCase (e.g., BannerController.php) # Route Naming - Do not add "list" in method names if URL already contains "list". - Example: Route::get('/banner/type/list', [BannerController::class, 'getBannerTypeList']); # Project Notes - Container name: php8 (not stars) - jq is not installed in the container - Project path: /var/www/html/stars ```
